snippet: With lines at Northeast gas stations persisting, the government turned to the Pentagon for help and eased limits on foreign tankers.
abstract: Defense Department will send 24 million gallons of fuel to the New York metropolitan area and lift restrictions on deliveries by foreign-flagged ships, as long lines persist at gas stations in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy; Obama administration authorizes hundreds of trucks to deliver 12 million gallons each of gasoline and diesel fuel to staging areas in New Jersey.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Eric Lipton reported from Washington and Clifford Krauss from Houston.

lead_paragraph: With lines at Northeast gas stations persisting, the government turned to the Pentagon for help and eased limits on foreign tankers.

headline.main: Military to Deliver Fuel to Storm-Ravaged Region
headline.print_headline: Military to Deliver Fuel to Storm-Ravaged Region
